data.title: Berachain to Roll Out Its Mainnet on Feb. 6
data.description:
Cult blockchain Berachain is set to go live on Feb. 6 at an unspecified time, per an X post.
The upcoming blockchain uses a proof-of-liquidity consensus mechanism to reward liquidity provision. In the past year, it has gained a cult following and an engaged social media community.
The blockchain is humorously set to launch in "Q5,” as the X post notes, a non-existent quarter beyond Q4 - which added to the anticipation for participating in Berachain-related platforms ahead of its mainnet launch.
Meanwhile, a pre-deposits application meant to bootstrap liquidity on Berachain racked up over $3 billion from users in under a week, as CoinDesk reported.
Read more: Berachain App Boyco Goes Live With $2.2B in 'Pre-Deposits'

data.title: Semler Scientific Buys Additional 871 BTC for $88.5M
data.description:
The analyst who wrote this piece owns shares of Semler Scientific (SMLR).

Semler Scientific (SMLR) has acquired an additional 871 BTC for $88.5 million, utilizing proceeds from its January 2025 senior convertible notes offering. The average purchase price per bitcoin was $101,616.

With this latest acquisition, Semler Scientific now holds 3,192 BTC, purchased at a total cost of $280.4 million, with an average purchase price of $87,854 per bitcoin.

According to the press release, Semler Scientific's BTC yield was 152.2%. The yield is the percentage change in the ratio of its bitcoin holdings to its full-diluted shares outstanding over a given period.

data.title: CME's Monthly Crypto Volumes Hits Record High in January, Surges 180%
data.description:
• The Chicago Mercantile Exchange Group achieved a record average daily volume of 25.7 million contracts in January, with cryptocurrency contracts reaching an ADV of 198,000.
  • Year-over-year, cryptocurrency ADV rose by 180%, driven by a 255% increase in micro bitcoin futures and a 223% jump in micro ether futures.

data.title: Trivago Adds Travala's Hotel Inventory, Gaining Crypto Payment Options
data.description:
• Travala, the travel website that accepts payments in cryptocurrency, has teamed up with trivago, adding its inventory of 2.2 million properties to the hotel search platform.
  • When trivago users select a Travala hotel they will be redirected to the company's website where they will have the option of paying in BTC, ETH and dozens of other cryptocurrencies.

data.title: WazirX Tells Creditors Accept New Scheme or Wait Until 2030 for Refunds From $230M Hack
data.description:
• WazirX creditors are set to vote on a restructuring scheme, with voting results potentially enabling creditors to start receiving their stolen crypto as early as April 2025 if approved by more than 75% of voting creditors by value.
  • If the scheme is not approved, the process would shift towards liquidation under Singapore's Companies Act, likely resulting in lower asset recovery for creditors with an estimated date of 2030.

data.title: Bitcoin Hashrate Hits All-Time High Defying Analyst Expectations
data.description:
• The bitcoin hash rate has hit an all-time high of 833 EH/s on a seven-day moving average.
  • Bitcoin transaction fees are at multi-year lows.

data.title: Galaxy and BitGo Buddy Up for Crypto Staking Despite Legal Spat
data.description:
• Galaxy’s staking business currently handles over $4 billion in staked assets, the firm said, having acquired blockchain node operator CryptoManufaktur last year.
  • In early 2023, BitGo filed a $100 million lawsuit alleging Galaxy intentionally breached its May 2021 merger agreement.

data.title: XRP Teases Bollinger Band Breakout Against Bitcoin: Godbole
data.description:
• XRP/BTC looks to end a prolonged range-play with a Bollinger band breakout.
  • The pattern is reminiscent of April 2017 that set the stage for a 200% surge.

data.title: Ethereum Raises Gas Limits for First Time Since 2021, Boosting ETH Appeal
data.description:
• Ethereum's capacity to handle transactions was enhanced as validators agreed to increase the gas limit to nearly 32 million units.
  • This marked the first significant adjustment since late 2021 and the first in the post-Merge era.
  • This increase was automatically implemented after over half of the validators signaled support without needing a hard fork.
  • A higher gas limit could increase the utility of the Ethereum network, potentially boosting investor interest in ETH, which has seen a decline in value relative to bitcoin.

data.title: Lending Protocol Aave Processes $200M in Liquidation Without Adding to Bad-Debt Burden
data.description:
• Aave registered $210 million in liquidations on Monday, according to Chaos Labs.
  • The protocol's existing bad debt declined amid price volatility.
